item.title: Automatically backup config with git and cron
item.description: An automated backup strategy for configuration files to make restoring from backups or purchasing a new computer easy.

item.title: Caching and the Least Recently Used Replacement Policy
item.description: What is caching, and how does the Least Recently Used replacement policy maintain values of interest in the cache?

item.title: Boids: A Bird Flock Simulator
item.description: We implement Craig Reynolds' Boids simulator using vanilla JavaScript and HTML5 Canvas, and explain the vector math required to drive the particle simulation.

item.title: The Knapsack Problem
item.description: Examining the Knapsack Problem and solutions using dynamic programming.

item.title: Introduction to Databases
item.description: What are databases? What are the similarities and differences from file systems? What is a SQL vs No-SQL database and the pros and cons of each for a given application?

item.title: Value vs Reference: Deep vs Shallow
item.description: A short tutorial on object copying in JS and the distinction between a shallow and deep copies, and values and references.

item.title: Draw Photo Histograms: D3 + Canvas
item.description: Exploring histograms using vanilla JavaScript, D3, and the FileReader API.

item.title: Histograms in D3 and Observable HQ
item.description: An introduction to creating histograms in D3 and the use of Observable HQ to make interactive notebooks for data exploration.

item.title: Prototypal Inheritance Basics
item.description: What are prototypes and what does prototypal inheritance mean in JavaScript? Covers the new keyword, Object.create, and ES5 class syntax.

item.title: ES6 â€” Destructuring + Default Parameters
item.description: Object and Array destructuring in ES6 allows you to easily extract selected properties of nested objects.

item.title: ES6 â€” Generator Functions
item.description: Generator functions let programmers use yield to pause the execution of functions until they are called later.

item.title: Lightning Fast String Lookups With Tries
item.description: Tries are a hybrid data structure combining a tree and hash table to provide O(k) lookup for k-character words, popular for use cases like typeahead and autocomplete.

item.title: Binary Heaps: Min-Heaps and Max-Heaps
item.description: Binary Heaps are binary-tree based data structures that can be used to implement a Priority Queue and provide O(1) insert and find-minimum performance.

item.title: AVL Trees Part 2: Insertions
item.description: Taking an in-depth look at node rebalancing after insertions in AVL trees.

item.title: AVL Trees Part 1: Balanced Binary Search and Rotations
item.description: AVL trees are self-balancing binary trees that avoid worst-case O(n) performance given increasing or decreasing inputs.

item.title: Binary Tree Application: Binary Space Partitioning
item.description: Binary space partitioning recursively subdivides a space. It is an application of binary trees and often used for procedurally generated game levels or computational art.

item.title: Binary Search Trees: Handling Deletion
item.description: Handling deletion in Binary Search Trees for nodes with zero, one, and two children.

item.title: Intro to Binary Search Trees
item.description: Binary Search Trees are are a data structure allowing O(log(N)) lookup of entries. We implement insertion, traversal, and search methods for Binary Search Trees.

item.title: Intro to Linked Lists
item.description: The Singly Linked List is a classic data structure. We implement length, insert, remove, and search methods, and compare the Linked List's big-O complexity to arrays.

item.title: Stacks, Queues, and Matching Brackets
item.description: Introducing the Stack and Queue data structures, using the Stack to implement a Code Linter to check for mismatched open and closing brackets.

item.title: Speeding Up Repetitive Calculations with Memoization
item.description: Introducing memoization, a technique to speed up computation by re-using previously computed results. Shows an exasmple using factorial and considers the time/space tradeoffs involved with memoization.

item.title: Koch Snowflakes
item.description: Building Fractal Art with Koch Snowflakes on HTML5 Canvas.

item.title: Pixl: A Sea of CSS [part 5]
item.description: Add CSS styling to make the app responsive on multiple screen sizes using media queries and flexbox.

item.title: Pixl: Scaling & Saving Art [part 4]
item.description: Enabling save and restore of images using the browser's localStorage API.

item.title: Pixl: Scaling & Saving Art [part 3]
item.description: Canvas scaling, transparent backgrounds, and a first step at saving the images.

item.title: Pixl: Color Palette & Enhanced UI [part 2]
item.description: Adding a randomized color palette selector using jscolor.

item.title: Pixl: A Pixel Art Editor w/Canvas [part 1]
item.description: A full-featured, 5-part tutorial on creating a pixel art editor using JavaScript and HTML5 Canvas. Supports saving and loading images, color selection, transparent backgrounds, and more.

item.title: Fractal Art and Sierpinski Triangles
item.description: Building a Sierpinski Triangle with HTML5 Canvas and JavaScript.

item.title: Events and Event Listeners in JavaScript
item.description: JavaScript is a fundamentally event-driven programming language. Learn about the event loop, adding handlers to events with listeners, and debouncing for limiting the number of times those handlers are called.

item.title: Document Object Model (DOM) Selectors
item.description: Introduces the Document Object Model view of a webpage, covering how we can use Selectors to select objects of interest on the page and manipulate them.

item.title: Map, Filter, and Reduce: Functional Programming Gems
item.description: Introduces Map, Filter, and Reduce methods with an Application example calculating Standard Deviation.

item.title: WebStorage API: localStorage and sessionStorage
item.description: WebStorage API, localStorage, and sessionStorage

item.title: Let's Code a Pomodoro Timer
item.description: We build a Pomodoro Timer, a popular time-management tool that breaks work in to 25 minutes segments of work combined with 5 minute periods of rest.

item.title: Scope & Closures: let vs var in JavaScript
item.description: Closures allow a function to retain information about its context after the function has returned. We provide examples and cases where closures can be useful.

item.title: Code a Weather App
item.description: We create a weather application using the National Weather Service API to learn about Asynchronous code using Promises and Application Programming Interfaces (APIs).

item.title: John Conway's Game of Life: Cellular Automata
item.description: John Conway's Game of Life simulation implemented in JavaScript.

item.title: Create an Animated LCD Display
item.description: We build a retro look-and-feel LCD display using dynamically-animated SVG with JavaScript.

item.title: Intro to D3 Graphs + visualize sorting algorithms
item.description: Visualizing Sorting Algorithms in D3

item.title: Intro to D3: Bar Graphs
item.description: We learn the basics of D3 and how to use it to build bar graphs.

item.title: Quicksort, a Divide and Conquer Sorting Algorithm.
item.description: We code Quicksort in JavaScript.

item.title: Bubble Sort
item.description: Bubble Sort algorithm, coded in JavaScript.

item.title: Binary Insertion Sort
item.description: Binary Insertion Sort algorithm, coded in JavaScript.

item.title: Insertion Sort
item.description: Insertion sort algorithm, coded in JavaScript.

item.title: Selection Sort
item.description: Selection sort algorithm, coded in JavaScript.

item.title: Binary Search
item.description: Binary search algorithm with a test runner implementation, coded in JavaScript.

item.title: Let's Implement a Stream Cipher (CTR)!
item.description: Implementing AES in CTR mode, a Stream Cipher, to solve Cryptopals Set 3 Challenge 18.

item.title: CBC Padding Oracle
item.description: Exploring a CBC padding oracle in Cryptopals Set 3 Challenge 17.

item.title: CBC Bitflipping Attacks
item.description: Even though CBC is more secure than ECB, it is still vulnerable to attacks without taking additional precautions like using a Message Authentication Code (MAC). Cryptopals Set 2 Challenge 16.

item.title: PKCS7 Padding Validation
item.description: Yet Another demonstration of why you shouldn't use ECB, even when some random-sized block of padding is prepended to the message. Cryptopals Set 2 Challenge 15.

item.title: ECB Byte At a Time (Harder!)
item.description: Yet Another demonstration of why you shouldn't use ECB, even when some random-sized block of padding is prepended to the message. Cryptopals Set 2 Challenge 14.

item.title: ECB Cut and Paste
item.description: Another demonstration of why you shouldn't use ECB! Cryptopals Set 2 Challenge 13.

item.title: Byte at a Time ECB Decryption
item.description: We demonstrate how to perform ECB decryption one byte at a time, a good demonstration of why ECB should not be used in practice. Instead, use CBC! Cryptopals Set 2 Challenge 12.

item.title: An AES CBC/ECB Detection Oracle!
item.description: We implement an ECB/CBC detection oracle for use in future challenges. This solves Cryptopals Set 2 Challenge 11.

item.title: Let's Implement Cipher Block Chaining!
item.description: We implement AES-CBC, a more secure mode of AES than ECB, to solve Cryptopals Set 2 Challenge 10.

item.title: Let's Implement PKCS7 Padding!
item.description: We implement PKCS7, a commonly used padding in cryptography. And we solve Cryptopals Set 2 Challenge 9!

item.title: Let's Detect AES! (AES in ECB Mode)
item.description: We learn how to detect AES encryption when used in its less-secure form, ECB mode. In the process, we solve Cryptopals Set 1 Challenge 8.

item.title: Let's Code AES! (AES in ECB Mode)
item.description: As an exercise, we code AES in ECB mode from scratch in JavaScript, and we use the results to solve Cryptopals Set 1 Challenge 7.

item.title: Break Repeating-Key XOR
item.description: How is repeating-key XOR is vulnerable to attack. Find out by Solving Cryptopals Set 1 Challenge 6.

item.title: Implement Repeating-Key XOR
item.description: Implement Repeating-key XOR, a slightly more secure version of the single-byte XOR cipher, and solve Cryptopals Set 1 Challenge 5.

item.title: Detecting The Single-Byte XOR Cipher
item.description: Find the secret text encrypted using a single-byte XOR cipher and solve Cryptopals Set 1 Challenge 4.

item.title: Cracking the Single-Byte XOR Cipher
item.description: Find the secret text encrypted using a single-byte XOR cipher and solve Cryptopals Set 1 Challenge 3.

item.title: Calculating Fixed XOR
item.description: Calculate a Fixed XOR between two strings and solve Cryptopals Set 1 Challenge 2.

item.title: Convert Hexadecimal String to Base-64
item.description: Calculate a Fixed XOR between two strings and solve Cryptopals Set 1 Challenge 1.
